entry.title: Slow PaintArtifactCompositor::Update for Perfetto FTrace UI with a lot of contents
entry.content: Originally reported in b/335451611. In non-composited scrolling mode, PAC::Update takes 0.5+s and 99% of frame update time. In compsited scrolling mode, some scrolls are smooth but there are obvious janks when the main thread needs update.

entry.title: Overlap Issue with Tooltip and 'Tools' Submenu on Google Search Page
entry.content:
Hello, I hope you're doing well üòä
I've encountered a display issue on the Google Search page. When the "Tools" menu is expanded and I click on the "More" button to display its tooltip, the tooltip is obscured by the "Tools" submenu.
**Steps to Reproduce:** 1. Go to the Google search page. 2. Click on the "Tools" button (labeled "Outils" in my screenshots, as I'm French), and a submenu will appear. 3. Click on the "More" button (labeled "Plus" in French), and a tooltip will appear. 4. ‚ùå Issue: Notice that the tooltip is hidden under the "Tools" submenu.
**Expected Behavior:** The tooltip should either disappear or remain on top of the submenu.
**Environment:** - Operating System: MacOS Version 14.4.1 (23E224) - Browsers where issue can be reproduced: - ‚ùå Chrome 124.0.6367.61 (Build officiel) (arm64) - ‚ùå Firefox 125.0.2 (64-bit)
**Note:**
I was not sure about the exact component to assign this issue to.
Have a nice day.

entry.title: Provide option to reuse last good build
entry.content:
On our team we reuse commits that we know have working builds to speed up subsequent pinpoint jobs.
For most parts _any_ commit that's somewhere close to `HEAD` is good enough.
It would be amazing, and probably speed up pinpoint jobs as well, if this was an option to select (maybe even default) when creating a job.

entry.title: Lost All bookmarks, history, saved passwords on chrome instantly!
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Ridiculous question. 2. All bookmarks are just POOF gone 3.
# Problem Description PLEASE is there a way to restore my history, saved passwords, bookmarks! This is a nightmare. was all working fine, and then BAM, I don't know why but my account didn't pop up anymore when I signed opened google, i had to re enter password each time I wanted to get in to find out what was wrong, I had earlier been in an incognito window that I closed. Spotify keeps randomly opening on my computer and I had to force quite it a few times. This is MESSED UP! We just go this new macBook air a few weeks ago and had not done a formal backup on it yet as we never had to do that on our old one. So 10 years of carefully curated bookmarks all gone!! Save passwords, everything?
# Additional Comments Already commented on another thread and got response that my issue was different. I do not even know how to explain how it is different. I just know that I was using all my bookmarks, passwords, etc yesterday and then POOF I was signed out of my google account and kept having to sign in again, and when I did NONE of my bookmarks were there anymore.
# Summary Lost All bookmarks, history, saved passwords on chrome instantly!
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Clean up flags that are enabled by default in PWA land with no Finch configs
entry.content:
Clean up the already enabled base::Features for PWA code defined in go/stale-base-features that doesn't have corresponding Finch configs.
A quick search for PWA shows the following features:
DesktopPWAsCacheDuringDefaultInstall DesktopPWAsEnforceWebAppSettingsPolicy DesktopPWAsIconHealthChecks DesktopPWAsTabStripSettings ImmersiveFullscreenPWAs PwaUpdateDialogForIcon QuickSettingsPWA
This is a high level bug to track these.

entry.title: Global heap limit uses live+dead for CppHeap
entry.content:
Global limit in V8 uses `GlobalSizeOfObjects()` for computing the global heap limit. At the time this is used this includes live+dead objects. The counter is set to live objects at the start of sweeping which unfortunately happens after limit computation.
For the pure JS limit we only consider live size which is correct.

entry.title: [css-ruby-1] Breaks within implicit bases is not Web-compatible
entry.content:
CSSWG added the following resolution(s):
> * `RESOLVED: Style anonymous bases with text-wrap-mode: nowrap as described in https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10073#issuecomment-1995455391` > * `RESOLVED: unresolve previous resolution`
in https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10073#issuecomment-2075297324
This bug was filed by the Spec Resolution Github Bot. This [doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1h3-Il_KusVrvVfC86yYhNtTWz5fEoBe3FraCOcZZLyU/edit) briefly describes the process. Please reach out to chrishtr@chromium.org for questions.

entry.title: [css-text] Should text-wrap-style:balance be allowed to affect the block height?
entry.content:
CSSWG added the following resolution(s):
> * `RESOLVED: Number of lines can change if it's 6+ lines being balanced, and note that this is about line breaks not content height shifts`
in https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10186#issuecomment-2075228123
This bug was filed by the Spec Resolution Github Bot. This [doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1h3-Il_KusVrvVfC86yYhNtTWz5fEoBe3FraCOcZZLyU/edit) briefly describes the process. Please reach out to chrishtr@chromium.org for questions.

entry.title: Migrate Chromium TODOs from Monorail IDs to new IssueTracker IDs
entry.content:
External tracker version of b/321899722
Chromium code contains lots of TODOs with crbug links, usually in the form:
``` // TODO(12345): Fix the thing. ``` or sometimes ``` // TODO(crbug/12345): Fix the thing. ``` or ``` // TODO(crbug.com/12345): Fix the thing. ```
With the migration from Monorail to the new Chromium Issue Tracker, these IDs no longer match the IDs in the bugs. There is a redirection service that allows you to get to the correct bug from a link in the code base but if you have a bug assigned to you and want to find any references to it in the code base, that is challenging.
Many instances of this are being automatically fixed but if you need to manually make a fix, all you need to do is navigate to the bug and then grab the new ID from the URL. Also make sure to use the canonical bug format which is `TODO(crbug.com/123456789)`.

entry.title: Kombucha's SendAccelerator() doesn't propagate to WebUI dialog
entry.content:
I've made an attempt to convert one of sign-in interactive tests to Kombucha in https://crrev.com/c/5476472/1 which failed because the dialog wasn't receiving an accelerator event send via SendAccelerator().
SignInViewControllerBrowserTest.EmailConfirmationDefaultFocus is quite simple: 1. open sign-in email confirmation WebUI dialog 2. wait until the page is "ready" 3. send RETURN key 4. verify that the dialog executes a default action and closes
[Kombucha version](https://crrev.com/c/5476472/1) of the test fails at step 3. The test passes if I press the "Enter" key manually. The issue might be that we don't wait enough in 2. but I doubt it. Inserting `FlushTasks()` before sending accelerator event didn't help.
Kombucha [had issues](https://crrev.com/c/4931440) with sending accelerator events to WebUI previously and I think that I'm hitting another instance of the same problem.
[This comment thread](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5476472/comment/7f899e0d_cb77c89e/) has some more context.

entry.title: The position: sticky attribute isn't working properly in RTL
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a scrollable fixed size parent element with direction: rtl and make it scrollable 2. Create a direct child element with position: sticky attribute with top (and/or right) set to 0 3. Create another direct child of the parent which has bigger dimensions than the parent (to make the parent scrollable)
# Problem Description The sticky child element will not actually be sticky and will disappear when the user scrolls too far. Do note that if you put a sticky element inside of the second child, it will actually work so the problem is really restricted to the direct children of the scrollable element. Here is a codepen to illustrate the problem: https://codepen.io/Julien-Carion/pen/OJGdxBd This may or may not be linked to https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40858399
# Summary The position: sticky attribute isn't working properly in RTL
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: https://codepen.io/Julien-Carion/pen/OJGdxBd
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Which other browsers (including versions) also have the problem? Safari, Edge (works in firefox)
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Tabs in group view are cut at the bottom
CSS selector "::slotted(input)::-webkit-inner-spin-button" does not work.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a custom element with a shadow root. 2. Add to the custom element's shadow root a SLOT element. Also add a STYLE element with the following CSS: "::slotted(input)::-webkit-inner-spin-button { display: none; }". 3. Pass on a INPUT element of type "number" to the custom element. 4. Hover over the INPUT element and see that the spin buttons are still there. The slotted styles are not being applied.
# Problem Description One way to hide the spin buttons (up/down arrows) inside an input of type "number" is by applying the following CSS: ::-webkit-inner-spin-button { display: none; } But when the input element is slotted into a custom element, and the custom element tries to apply these styles, then this does not work. Selector used: ::slotted(input)::-webkit-inner-spin-button { display: none; } (The same may go for "webkit-outer-spin-button")
# Additional Comments See attached "index.html" for the broken scenario, as well as a working scenario (without custom element). OS: macOS 14.4.1
# Summary CSS selector "::slotted(input)::-webkit-inner-spin-button" does not work.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Consider deprecating isInputPending()
entry.content:
Chromium is the only engine that has shipped this API. But our view on it has changed over time. From our [updated guidance on long tasks](https://web.dev/articles/optimize-long-tasks#isinputpending):
> since the launch of that API, our understanding of yielding has improved, especially after the introduction of INP. We **no longer recommend using this API**, and instead recommend yielding **regardless of whether input is pending or not**.
The [current usage](https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/2794) is too high to unship immediately, so the first step is to add more metrics to understand where the usage is coming from and whether it can be easily changed.

entry.title: cctest/test-api/IdentityHash failing
entry.content:
In ToT, this fails consistently and it's not a new issue:
``` $ out/x64.debug/cctest test-api/IdentityHash --random-seed=-588828964
# Fatal error in ../../test/cctest/test-api.cc, line 3294 # Check failed: o1->GetIdentityHash() != o2->GetIdentityHash() (471595 vs. 471595). ```
Notice that the random seed is important; with a different value it (most probably) will not crash.
I bisected it to [this CL](https://crrev.com/c/4839486), which landed in September 2023 and flipped the flag for snapshot rehashing. Indeed, the invocation above does not fail with `--rehash-snapshot`. But I don't think that the issue is related to that CL or the snapshot. Rehashing the snapshot uses more random numbers from the generator, so we would just need a different seed to make it fail again.
I think this is simply a case where the random number generator gives the same hash to two different objects.

entry.title: overflow-clip-margin doesn't support calc()
entry.content:
overflow-clip-margin doesn't support calc().
Any clac function in overflow-clip-margin will be reported as an invalid property value.

entry.title: Remove kForYouFre feature flag check from chrome/browser/ui/startup/first_run_service.cc
Remove kForYouFre feature flag check from chrome/browser/ui/webui/intro/intro_ui.cc
Pairing Fail with Google Pixel phones (4a,3a,6).
entry.content:
Pairing is failing with Pixel Phones 4a,3a,6
Ref Devices: Pixel 3a,4a,and 6.
Steps: 1. Keep the IUT on discoverable mode 2. Pair from Pixel 4a,3a,6
Analysis:
Ref device is sending 'IO Capability Request' event is before 'Read Remote Extended Features' event received.
IUT will reply to 'IO Capability Request' with 'IO Capability Request Reply' command only after receiving 'Read Remote Extended Features' event [for which IUT send cmd Read Remote Extended Features]. In case of Pixel 4a,3a, and 6, these ref devices are sending 'IO Capability Request' event before 'Read Remote Extended Features' event received.Hence IUT is not sending 'IO Capability Request Reply' command which leads pairing failure.
Tested with other Android phones, pairing is working correctly. 'IO Capability Request' event is sent [from other Android Phones] after 'Read Remote Extended Features' event received. and IUT responded with 'IO Capability Request Reply' command and Pairing succeeded.
Logs: > HCI Event: IO Capability Response (0x32) plen 9 #15 [hci0] 31.008861 Address: DC:E5:5B:3E:57:FB (Google, Inc.) IO capability: DisplayYesNo (0x01) OOB data: Authentication data not present (0x00) Authentication: Dedicated Bonding - MITM required (0x03) > HCI Event: IO Capability Request (0x31) plen 6 #16 [hci0] 31.008875 Address: DC:E5:5B:3E:57:FB (Google, Inc.) < HCI Command: Read Remote Extended Features (0x01|0x001c) plen 3 #18 [hci0] 31.034387 Handle: 1 Address: DC:E5:5B:3E:57:FB (Google, Inc.) Page: 1 > HCI Event: Command Status (0x0f) plen 4 #19 [hci0] 31.035334 Read Remote Extended Features (0x01|0x001c) ncmd 1 Status: Success (0x00) > ACL Data RX: Handle 1 flags 0x02 dlen 10 #20 [hci0] 31.037280 L2CAP: Information Request (0x0a) ident 2 len 2 Type: Extended features supported (0x0002) > HCI Event: Max Slots Change (0x1b) plen 3 #21 [hci0] 31.038697 Handle: 1 Address: DC:E5:5B:3E:57:FB (Google, Inc.) Max slots: 5 > HCI Event: Read Remote Extended Features (0x23) plen 13 #22 [hci0] 31.049613 Status: Success (0x00) Handle: 1 Address: DC:E5:5B:3E:57:FB (Google, Inc.) Page: 1/2 Features: 0x0b 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 Secure Simple Pairing (Host Support) LE Supported (Host) Secure Connections (Host Support)

entry.title: Custom CSS cursor not showing after triggering navigation.back();
Remove kForYouFre feature flag check from chrome/browser/ui/startup/startup_browser_creator_impl.cc
Register global shortcut for keycode 0 will lead to unexpected result on Linux/X11
error chrome bug
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Graphical artifacts in inset box shadow
entry.content:
Bug is visible on the latest Chrome: Chrome Version: 124.0.6367.61 (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) OS: Windows 11 Version 23H2 (Build 22631.3447) I've tested archive builds and traced regression: 88.0.4289.0 dev - broken 815960 e8d15ca69fd9c9ae88a589018a069a9b5569e123 88.0.4286.0 dev - ok 814962 5034c8b9252e1cb6dd75fbfea8f184c53de8de0b I didn't verify this, but probably this [Skia update] (https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/98a887fbb1fa0992e2220260acf54291a58d7362) introduced this problem What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Open a page with a box-shadow, eg.:
(2) Gradually change the browser window size to roughly match the size of the div What is the expected result? Applied box-shadow stays intact What happens instead? At some window height value the graphical artifact will start to appear at the bottom of the div

entry.title: Observed issue while accessing the inhouse website within the local network without internet.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Observed issue while accessing the inhouse website within the local network without internet. 2. Issue observed after version 124.x.x earlier version working fine 3. We are suspecting Remove enterprise policies used for TLS handshake and RSA key usage with newer version
# Problem Description Not able to access website hosted in local network after version upgrade. All other browser (IE, Edge,Firefox, etc ) works well
# Additional Comments Any Locally hosted website which accessible within the local network.
# Summary Observed issue while accessing the inhouse website within the local network without internet.
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Remove EventOnTimelineData.url
entry.content:
We rely on EventOnTimelineData.url in a few places to associate URLs to events which we then show in the UI in various places.
We need to replicate this in the new engine or replace it with a helper.

entry.title: I might violate terms and conditions with no intentions.
entry.content:
Version: 15481-ab9382a From Link: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/builder-search?q=GuPZ5nAFjVc Please enter a description of the problem, with repro steps if applicable.
sorry if I did something I should not have done.

entry.title: After refresh, a totally different layout is being used for distillability detection.
entry.content:
URL: https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-68872783
On first load, features are extracted and distillability is detected. After refresh, a totally different layout is being used for distillability detection. Hence, resulting in the article now being classified as non-distillable. When we log the features for the page, it can be seen that all the text length features are 0 after refresh.

entry.title: [Google drive] While uploading the file, Clicking on the ‚Äúcancel‚Äù is showing the status of the file as completed and the file is getting uploaded into the drive
entry.content:
Chrome Version :123.0.6312.134 (Official Build) (64-bit)/15786.60.0 (Official Build) stable-channel
OS: Chrome OS, Windows, Mac
Regression: NO
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Chrome and open Google drive from **‚Äòdrive.google.com‚Äô** / Google apps. 2. Click on the ‚ÄòNew‚Äô button and upload any file into the drive by clicking on **‚ÄúFile upload‚Äù** 3. While the file is getting uploaded, **cancel** the file upload. 4. Observe that the status of the file and search for the uploaded file.
**Actual Result** : While uploading the file, Clicking on the **‚Äúcancel‚Äù** is showing the status of the file as completed and the file is getting uploaded into the drive.
**Expected Result** : While uploading the file, Clicking on the **‚Äúcancel‚Äù** Should not show the status of the file as completed and the file should not be uploaded into the drive.
Please find the attached screen cast below..!
Note: 1. Issue is reproducible on **Canary#126.0.6434.0(15864.0.0), Dev #125.0.6422.11(15853.10.0), Beta #124.0.6367.89(15823.38.0)**. 2. Issue is reproducible on **Hatch, Snappy, Nami, Kappa and Octopus** 3. This is a NR issue.
